K.text: Count forward orally by ones to 100, count backward orally by ones from 20, and identify one more and one less than a number up to 20
Recognize and name the number of items in a set of 10 or fewer items using one-to-one correspondence
Model addition and subtraction of whole numbers up to 10, using concrete objects
Identify, describe, and trace plane figures (circle, triangle, square, and rectangle) regardless of their positions and orientations in space

1.text: Count forward orally by ones to 120, count backward orally by ones from 20, and identify one more and one less than a number up to 120
Group a collection of up to 120 objects into tens and ones and write the corresponding numeral
Recall basic addition facts with sums to 10 or less and the corresponding subtraction facts
Add and subtract within 20 using concrete objects, pictorial representations, and paper and pencil
Estimate and then use nonstandard units to measure length and weight

2.text: Read, write, and identify the place value of each digit in a three-digit numeral
Recall basic addition and subtraction facts through 20
Estimate and measure length to the nearest inch and centimeter and weight to the nearest pound
Apply the problem-solving process to solve problems that contain one-step solutions

3.text: Read and write six-digit numerals and identify the place value and value of each digit
Round whole numbers, 9,999 or less, to the nearest ten, hundred, and thousand
Add and subtract whole numbers written in vertical and horizontal form, checking answers using various methods
Represent multiplication and division through 10 × 10, using arrays, area models, sets of objects, and number lines
Estimate and use U.S. Customary and metric units to measure length to the nearest 1/2 inch, inch, foot, yard, centimeter, and meter

4.text: Read, write, represent, and identify the place value and value of each digit in decimals through thousandths
Estimate sums, differences, products, and quotients of whole numbers and describe the method of estimation
Add, subtract, and multiply whole numbers written in vertical and horizontal form
Estimate and measure weight/mass and describe the results in U.S. Customary and metric units
Identify and describe representations of points, lines, line segments, rays, and angles

5.text: Investigate and recognize the identity and the commutative, associative, and distributive properties for addition and multiplication of whole numbers
Read, write, and identify the place value of decimals through millionths
Create and solve single-step and multistep practical problems involving addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of whole numbers
Find the sum, difference, product, and quotient of two numbers expressed as decimals through thousandths
Identify and classify angles as right, acute, obtuse, or straight

6.text: Read, write, represent, compare, and order integers
Compare and order positive rational numbers represented as fractions, mixed numbers, decimals, and percents
Multiply and divide fractions and mixed numbers
Solve single-step and multistep practical problems involving addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of decimals
Derive π (pi) and solve problems involving circumference and area of a circle

7.text: Represent and order rational numbers on a number line
Add, subtract, multiply, and divide integers
Add, subtract, multiply, and divide rational numbers
Apply similarity and proportional reasoning to solve practical problems
Represent and solve two-step linear equations in one variable

8.text: Simplify expressions that contain rational numbers and positive integer exponents
Estimate, determine, and verify solutions to practical problems involving rational numbers
Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to solve problems involving right triangles
Represent, solve, and justify solutions to two-step linear equations and inequalities in one variable

K.text: Use the five senses to make observations
Ask questions and make predictions about familiar objects and events
Recognize basic patterns in weather and the importance of weather to living things
Observe and identify basic needs of plants and animals

1.text: Demonstrate an understanding of scientific reasoning, logic, and the nature of science by planning and conducting investigations
Investigate and understand how weather and seasonal changes affect plants, animals, and their surroundings
Investigate and understand that animals, including humans, have basic needs and specific physical characteristics
Investigate and understand that plants have basic needs and certain distinguishing characteristics

2.text: Demonstrate an understanding of scientific reasoning, logic, and the nature of science by planning and conducting investigations
Investigate and understand basic properties of solids, liquids, and gases
Investigate and understand that plants and animals undergo a series of orderly changes in their life cycles
Investigate and understand that the sun is important to life on Earth

3.text: Demonstrate an understanding of scientific reasoning, logic, and the nature of science by planning and conducting investigations
Investigate and understand that objects are made of materials that can be described by their physical properties
Investigate and understand different forms of energy
Investigate and understand that natural events and humans influence ecosystems

4.text: Demonstrate an understanding of scientific reasoning, logic, and the nature of science by planning and conducting investigations
Investigate and understand the characteristics of electricity
Investigate and understand how plants and animals, including humans, in an ecosystem interact with one another and with the nonliving components in the ecosystem
Investigate and understand the organization of the solar system

5.text: Demonstrate an understanding of scientific reasoning, logic, and the nature of science by planning and conducting investigations
Investigate and understand that matter is anything that has mass, takes up space, and occurs as a solid, liquid, or gas
Investigate and understand basic characteristics of visible light and how it behaves
Investigate and understand how the Earth's surface changes over time

english.text: Identify, say, and use rhyming words
Identify and name the capital and lowercase letters of the alphabet
Draw pictures and/or use letters and phonetically spelled words to write about experiences
Continue to develop oral communication skills
Use phonetic strategies when reading and spelling
Apply knowledge of consonants and vowels to decode words
Use meaning clues and language structure when reading
Use a writing process to develop writing
Continue to demonstrate growth in oral communication skills
Use phonetic strategies when reading and spelling
Read familiar stories, poems, and passages with fluency and expression
Use context clues to understand unfamiliar words
Use a writing process to develop writing
Use effective communication skills in group activities
Read familiar text with fluency and expression
Read and comprehend a variety of fiction texts
Read and comprehend a variety of nonfiction texts
Use a variety of graphic organizers and reference sources

history.text: Develop an awareness of history as the study of the past
Understand the difference between past and present
Recognize symbols and traditions of the United States
Describe past and present family life
Explain the importance of rules and consequences
Develop an understanding of historical chronology
Compare life in America today with life in the past
Develop an understanding of historical thinking skills
Explain how the contributions of ancient China and Egypt have influenced the present world
Explain how the contributions of ancient Greece, Rome, and Mali have influenced the present world

health.text: Identify basic health habits that promote personal health and wellness
Identify safety rules for the home, school, and community
Identify personal health habits that promote health and wellness
Describe basic safety rules for home, school, and community
Explain the relationship between healthy behaviors and personal health
Explain the relationship between healthy behaviors and personal health
Describe how the environment can affect personal health
